messageBody:
Hi All,

I am sorry, I used "Recursive" in place of "Repetitive".
Which has changed the whole problem itself.

Let me try to explain my problem again.
I want to implement something like this scenario

public MyClass
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
while(true)
{
// execute the test cases.
}
}
}

I have a TestSuite, which is having all my TestCases.
My setUp() and tearDown() functions make sure that I don't execute them
for all the test cases,
Indeed, these methods run once only, so I have initialization done only
once.
I am quite comfortable with running my TestSuite, which runs all the
test cases in it.
Now my requirement is I need to run it continuously, say for more than
24 hours or so.
So I need to run my TestSuite "Repetitively" and not "Recursively".

I apologies for the mistake, and look forward for your suggestions.

With Regards,
Rakesh.


-----Original Message-----
From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
Sent: Saturday, September 27, 2003 11:28 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Recursive TestRunner


Rakesh wrote:

> Hi All,
>
> Can we run a TestSuite recursively ?
>
> I have designed a set of test cases which I have added to a TestSuite.
> Now I want to run this TestSuite recursively.
> Is there any way to do that ?

Maybe, but you need to explain what you want to do. I don't think
"recursive" is the right word for what you mean. I have no idea what it
means to execute a test suite recursively. Why does it invoke itself?
When does it stop?
